results.title: Leave me alone: sexual harassment in the workplace
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Ian MacArthur and Nick Frazer
results.brief_description: Made for the National Committee on Discrimination in Employment and Occupation. Provides examples of unwelcome behaviour of a sexual nature which may or may not be sexual harassment and invites discussion. It attempts to assist managers to recognise the consequences of sexual harassment to an organisation, suggests how an organisation might respond to the issue and provides guidance to managers and supervisors on the skills required to handle the problem. Accompanied by an 18p. manual of the same title.

results.title: Leave it to the chimneys
results.creator_credit: Crawford Productions and Anti Cancer Council
results.brief_description: Seeks to educate the viewer about the hazards of cigarette smoking. Animation and medical photography reveal what smoking can do to the lungs. Directed towards young teenagers who may be making up their minds about whether they should smoke or not. No other credits available.

results.title: Leave it to Beaver
results.brief_description: Leave it to Beaver is a family comedy focusing on the antics of Beaver, (a name given to the young boy by his older brother who couldn’t pronounce Theodore). In this episode called “Younger Brother” we see “The Beav” sign up for basketball following in the footsteps of his big brother but unlike his sporty brother Beaver is not a natural at basketball. Hiding his new sneakers as no wear on them would look suspicious Beaver pretends to be going to Basketball practice. During this episode we see understanding and kindness shown to Beaver when he confesses to his father and all is understood. As it turn out checkers could be Beavers thing. This television series presents life through the eyes of children and although the comedy might be slightly dated the issues are relevant to modern times. Cast includes Jerry Mathers, Barbara Billingsley, Hugh Beaumont, and Tony Dow.

results.title: Leave Britney Alone
results.brief_description: “Leave Britney Alone” is a viral video in which YouTube celebrity Chris Crocker cries while pleading with viewers to leave pop star Britney Spears alone.

results.title: Leave 'em laughing
results.creator_credit: Charles Fries Productions, Julian Fowles and Jackie Cooper
results.brief_description: This made for television drama based on the life story of the much-loved Chicago circus clown, Jack Thum, stars Mickey Rooney in one of his most poignant and memorable roles along with Anne Jackson as Shirlee, Thum’s loving and devoted wife. Cast also includes Allen Goorwitz, Elisha Cook, Michael Le Clair, William Windom, Red Buttons.

results.title: Leatherwork
results.creator_credit: New South Wales. Dept. of Education
results.brief_description: A demonstration of the basic techniques involved in leatherwork including the different methods of transferring a pattern, methods of carving, the different tools available for decorating and staining and finishing the leather.

results.title: Leather jackets (Tipulidae)
results.creator_credit: Shell Film Unit, Stephen Ackroyd and J.V. Durden
results.brief_description: The life cycle of the crane fly or “daddy-long-legs” the larvae of which, called Leather Jackets, feed just below the surface of the soil destroying the roots and underground portions of the plants. Stages shown include the action of the larvae in the soil; the pupation stage; emergence of the adult crane fly; reproduction of species; laying of eggs; finally, hatching of the young Leather Jackets.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Shell Film Unit, Stephen Ackroyd and J.V. Durden

results.title: Leather
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the basic techniques of an ancient craft that has a recent renaissance. The techniques covered in this excellent introduction to the leather work’s art will stimulate creativity and original design.

results.title: Lease on life
results.creator_credit: Ermerson Yorke Studio and Emerson Yorke
results.brief_description: The story of an average American family and how they plan to avoid unnecessary illness. Shows the forces of prevention in action, the conflict between superstition and fact, and the effective combination of skilled hands and trained minds in medical teamwork, with special reference to anti-tuberculosis measures.
